method: Calculate the enthalpy change using bond energies. For bonds broken: CH4 has 4 C-H bonds (4 × 413 = 1652 kJ) and 2 O2 molecules provide 2 O=O bonds (2 × 498 = 996 kJ). Total bonds broken = 1652 + 996 = 2648 kJ. For bonds formed: CO2 has 2 C=O bonds (2 × 805 = 1610 kJ) and 2 H2O molecules have 4 O-H bonds (4 × 463 = 1852 kJ). Total bonds formed = 1610 + 1852 = 3462 kJ. Apply ΔH = sum(bonds broken) - sum(bonds formed) = 2648 - 3462 = -814 kJ mol-1. The negative value indicates an exothermic reaction.

Bonds formed = (2 × 805) + (4 × 463) = 1610 + 1852 = 3462 kJ, verified by addition.
ΔH = 2648 - 3462 = -814 kJ mol-1, consistent with combustion being exothermic.
